item.description: Beijing has criticised the Dalai Lama's first Grammy win, describing the music industry award for an audiobook, narration and storytelling as "a tool for anti-China political manipulation".

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess arrested before his trial on rape and other charges
item.description: The trial is opening just as his mother faces renewed scrutiny over her contacts with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Donald Trump threatens to sue Grammys host Trevor Noah over Epstein joke
item.description: T﻿he US president raged on social media over a quip the comedian made at yesterday's awards show.

item.title: Man, 25, charged with murder over death of newborn baby
item.description: The boy was taken to hospital in July 2024, in a critical condition but with no obvious injuries. He died days later.

item.title: Today in History - February 3: Australian judge forced to hang man he thinks is innocent
item.description: Ronald Ryan became the last person to die by capital punishment on February 3, 1967, despite contradictory evidence and huge protests.

item.title: US Justice Department says it's taken down Epstein-related files that may have had victim information
item.description: S﻿everal thousand documents and media files have been pulled offline, the US Justice Department says.

item.title: Search for missing swimmer to resume after heavy Sydney seas
item.description: T﻿he man, aged in his 30s, was last seen swimming with friends off Maroubra Beach on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Dominican police say bodies of four decapitated women found near border with Haiti
item.description: A﻿uthorities in the Dominican Republic are investigating because one of the bodies was found on their side.

item.title: Treasurer defends government spending ahead of expected rates hike
item.description: Mortgage holders are bracing for a rates hike today, but Jim Chalmers insists the government isn't to blame.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson sent email to Jeffrey Epstein calling him a 'legend' and sparking rumours the financier fathere
item.description: S﻿he called the sex trafficker a "legend" and the "brother I always wished for".

item.title: Flood warnings across multiple states amid new cyclone fears
item.description: A﻿ tropical low currently drenching the NT could form a cyclone in the coming days, it's been warned.

item.title: Former Liberal senator Cory Bernardi joins One Nation
item.description: P﻿auline Hanson will today announce the conservative figure as the latest recruit for her populist party.

item.title: Body of man found on Sydney beach
item.description: P﻿olice say the grim discovery is not shark related.

item.title: Sydney woman left bruised and with a brain bleed after she was hit by an e-bike
item.description: A﻿n eldery woman has been left brusied and with a brain bleed after she was hit by a child on an e-bike.

item.title: Gaza-Egypt border reopens nearly two years after Israel closed it
item.description: I﻿t comes two years after Israel slammed the border shut, at the height of the war against Hamas.

item.title: Hate speech laws to reach into classrooms, teachers, NSW Premier Chris Minns announces
item.description: T﻿he NSW premier said the classroom would now be considered a venue for publicly inciting racial hate.

item.title: Melania Trump's movie bombs at the Australian box office
item.description: It narrowly beat a two-year-old movie that was showing on a single screen nationwide.

item.title: Iconic Sydney brewery to shut its doors
item.description: A popular brewery is set to shut its doors ﻿in Sydney's inner west in search of a tree change.

item.title: Australia rolls out world-first vaccine trial for children with aggressive brain tumours
item.description: A world-first trial in Australia will treat children with advanced brain cancer using technology from the COVID-19 jab.

item.title: Bill and Hillary Clinton agree to testify on Jeffrey Epstein rather than risk prison
item.description: The political power couple have agreed to testify on what they know about Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: UK politician Peter Mandelson under pressure to quit over Jeffrey Epstein links
item.description: T﻿he former ambassador and political high flyer is accused of of passing government files to the convicted pedophile.

item.title: Two sunscreens recalled due to uneven texture and 'visible water'
item.description: The TGA said this could affect the SPF of the sunscreen and may cause inadequate sun protection.

item.title: Australian government issues warning for would-be parents over surrogacy in Argentina
item.description: "﻿You may be refused entry," Smart Traveller has cautioned.

item.title: Body found in search for missing swimmer in Sydney's east
item.description: While a formal process is yet to confirm the ﻿identity of the body, it is believed to be that of the missing swimmer.

item.title: US man in 'au pair affair' case convicted of murdering wife and another man in elaborate ruse
item.description: Brendan Banfield is found to have created an elaborate ruse involving a fetish website and a fall guy who was lured to the house.

item.title: The RBA has hiked interest rates. So what does that mean for your mortgage?
item.description: Homeowners on a variable interest rate for their home loan could see repayments surge by around $100 per month.

item.title: Israeli president's visit 'a factor' in decision to extend Sydney protest ban
item.description: Police have announced the extension of the protest ban for two more weeks in parts of Sydney ahead of the visit of Israeli president Isaac Herzog.

item.title: 'Not today': Hero teen, 13, tells of exhaustive effort to save family out at sea
item.description: A teenage boy has spoken out after he swam and ran several kilometres to raise the alarm after his family was swept out to sea on WA's south-west coast.

item.title: Former boss pressed on missed message over 1994 disappearance of Sydney escort
item.description: The final shift for sex worker Revelle Balmain was meant to have settled her debts and given her extra cash to chase her dreams.

item.title: 'Absolutely abhorrent': Melbourne mayor condemns copycat posters of accused Bondi shooter
item.description: An image of alleged gunman Naveed Akram with the caption "Aussie" has been plastered in multiple locations in Melbourne's CBD.

item.title: AS IT HAPPENED: RBA hikes rates, but not sure what comes next
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia has done what mortgage-holders were dreading and hiked interest rates.

item.title: Coalition remains in tatters despite 'constructive' talks, peace offering
item.description: Despite an olive branch from Sussan Ley, the Nationals are yet take the Liberals up on their reunion offer.

item.title: Construction workers narrowly avoid falling scaffolding on Sydney job site
item.description: More than a tonne of scaffolding has narrowly missed a group of construction workers after plummeting more than 20 storeys at a jobsite in Sydney's north.

item.title: Sad twist for family of missing schoolgirl Bung Siriboon as mother enters palliative care
item.description: The mother of missing schoolgirl Bung Siriboon is living out her final days after a two-year battle with cancer.

item.title: Up to 150 Victorian GPs to be upskilled to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children
item.description: Currently, adults in Victorian can only be diagnosed and treated ﻿by a psychiatrist, while children must see a paediatrician or a psychiatrist.

item.title: Seven-figure reward remains open as hundreds scour bush for Dezi Freeman
item.description: T﻿he new search for accused cop killer Dezi Freeman has entered its second day in northern Victoria.

item.title: Stunned witnesses spot space junk re-enter earth's atmosphere above Victoria
item.description: Observational Astronomer Associate Professor Michael Brown said the phenomenon was likely a piece of Musk's Starlink-5103 re-entering the sky.

item.title: Sydney Mardi Gras' $2 million party cancelled amid 'existential threat' to festival
item.description: T﻿he CEO said the festival had suffered "two years of significant financial loss" and the $2 million "festival within a festival" had run at a loss every year since the pandemic.

item.title: Commuter chaos as wiring fault grounds train services in Melbourne
item.description: M﻿elbourne commuters have faced major peak hour delays after an overhead power fault forced the suspension of multiple train lines.

item.title: Fears homes may have been lost as bushfires rage in South Australia
item.description: There are fears homes may have been lost in an erratic and fast-moving bushfire burning out of control on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula.

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess pleads not guilty to rape charges as his trial opens in Oslo
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby stood for 24 minutes while prosecutor Sturla Henriksbø read out the 38 counts against him at the Oslo district court, asking him if he pleaded guilty.

item.title: Queensland police officer knocked unconscious by fleeing driver
item.description: A police officer on the Gold Coast has been taken to hospital after he was struck by a car while responding to reports of an armed person.

item.title: Bushwalker found in NSW Blue Mountains thanks to 'crucial item'
item.description: The 71-year-old was last seen early on Monday morning after telling his family he was going to embark on a 30-kilometre bushwalk.

item.title: French offices of Elon Musk's X platform raided by Paris cybercrime unit
item.description: A Paris prosecutor said the investigation, opened in January 2025, was broadened to include "Grok's sexualised deepfakes".

item.title: Queensland government's plan to boost housing by selling off state land draws criticism
item.description: The new developer-driven housing scheme has drawn criticism from local residents and housing advocates alike.

item.title: Big four banks all pass on RBA rate hike
item.description: Australia's big four banks have all moved to pass on the Reserve Bank of Australia's interest rate hike.
